channel.title: Good things to get for my laptop
channel.description:
Hey,
Well, today I got my new laptop and it's tons better than my old XP, but I need to get some stuff! I have Windows 7 Premium with an i3 Core. I have a lot of the stuff I absolutely need (such as anti virus) but I need some more good things to get. I'm downloading eclipse right now and I have Skype, DropBox and photoshop. If you have any suggestions then please tell me! Thanks!

item.title: Good things to get for my laptop
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

Definitely get linux.

Here are some links to help you, take your pick:

http://ubuntu.com

getfedora.org

Get Fedora

Choose Freedom. Choose Fedora. Pick a flavor of Fedora streamlined for your needs, and get to work right away.

http://www.opensuse.org/en/

http://www.archlinux.org/

Read full topic
item.source: Good things to get for my laptop

item.title: Good things to get for my laptop
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Linux runs Java apps better then my windows laptop lol (what RSPS’s are coded in).

Read full topic
item.source: Good things to get for my laptop

item.title: Good things to get for my laptop
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Meh, anything you can get working on Windows, you can get working on Linux.

Read full topic
item.source: Good things to get for my laptop

item.title: Good things to get for my laptop
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:16, topic:415261”][quote author=runewings317 link=topic=517218.msg3756896#msg3756896 date=1316549888]

Linux!

Get linux, and no it won’t mess everything up, just have it as a duel boot.

btw, everything on the internet is free
[/quote]When I say mess up everything, I mean will I have to do something different with my servers run files and shit? :o And will I still be able to play RS. I heard that you can’t really play RS and RSPS on Linux.

I don’t know who told you that… I play games all the time, and most RSPS are programmed in Java which is an entirely cross-platform language.[/quote]No one told me directly, but I was thinking about trying Linux out on my old XP (until the hard drive went bye bye) and I googled stuff about it and it said that some games (such as CoD and games you buy) won’t work with it cause their made for windows and I didn’t know if that went for RS and RSPS too or not. Just got Eclipse all done and now I’m going to try open office again!

Read full topic
item.source: Good things to get for my laptop

item.title: Good things to get for my laptop
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“runewings317, post:11, topic:415261”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=517218.msg3756869#msg3756869 date=1316547911]

Linux!

Get linux, and no it won’t mess everything up, just have it as a duel boot.

btw, everything on the internet is free
[/quote]When I say mess up everything, I mean will I have to do something different with my servers run files and shit? :o And will I still be able to play RS. I heard that you can’t really play RS and RSPS on Linux.[/quote]

I don’t know who told you that… I play games all the time, and most RSPS are programmed in Java which is an entirely cross-platform language.

Read full topic
item.source: Good things to get for my laptop

item.title: Good things to get for my laptop
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

[quote=“runewings317, post:11, topic:415261”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=517218.msg3756869#msg3756869 date=1316547911]

Linux!

Get linux, and no it won’t mess everything up, just have it as a duel boot.

btw, everything on the internet is free
[/quote]When I say mess up everything, I mean will I have to do something different with my servers run files and shit? :o And will I still be able to play RS. I heard that you can’t really play RS and RSPS on Linux.[/quote]

no it will not hurt playing rs or rsps or make ur servers not run or whatever. u could make a copy of ur hdd as a vm withhttp://www.vmware.com/products/converter/ so u keep ur current windows install and keep ur recover partititon. back that file up on an external HDD. install ubuntu over the entire HDD. get virtual box and convert the vmware vm to a vbox vm like this: http://www.kleinfelter.com/node/135 or http://blogs.oracle.com/fatbloke/entry/moving_a_vmware_vm_to woot now u have the awesomeness of linux with the ability to use windows if need be.

edit: actually all i had to do was use the .vmdk as the HDD for the new vm in virtualbox, i had to add some settings that gave the vm direct access to the actual hardware so windows would boot(the built-in security windows had wouldnt let it boot do to so many different hardware changes. if im correct i think that has to do with the HAL.). this vm will be good for anything windows that cant run on linux except for games… i suggest getting a copy of say windows xp and installing it to maybe 10-30 gigs of disk space(install the game directories on an external HDD), then have the rest for ubuntu.

Read full topic
item.source: Good things to get for my laptop

item.description:

Read full topic
